title: Coursework
text:
This page highlights the UCLA courses that shape my Statistics & Data Science background.






CCAS 10A – Chicano History & Culture

STATS 100A – Introduction to Probability

STATS 20 – Programming with R






STATS 100B – Introduction to Mathematical Statistics

STATS 101A – Introduction to Data Analysis and Regression

STATS 102A – Introduction to Computational Statistics with R






COMM 188C – Data Science for Social Good

STATS 100C – Linear Models

STATS 102B – Introduction to Computation & Optimization






DGT HUM 101 – Digital Humanities

STATS 101B – Design & Analysis of Experiments

STATS 102C – Monte Carlo Methods









STATS 101C – Regression and Data Mining

STATS 140XP – Statistics Consulting






AF AMER 112A – The Sunken Place

FILM TV 183A – Film & TV Development

STATS 141XP – Statistics Consulting (Capstone sequence)







Statistical Theory & Methods – STATS 100A–C, 101A–C

Computing & Optimization – STATS 20, 102A–C

Applied & Consulting – STATS 101B, 140XP, 141XP

Interdisciplinary Work – Data science for social good, digital humanities, film & media, and ethnic studies

title: Coursework
text:
Stats 102B – Intro to Computation & Optimization for Statistics
R programming, optimization algorithms, regression with regularization.
Stats 102C – Regression & Statistical Learning
Linear/logistic regression, glmnet, cross-validation, model selection.
Stats 140XP – Design & Analysis of Experiments
ANOVA, mixed designs, randomized experiments, R + report writing.





Psychology / Sociology research courses
Data collection, survey design, basic modeling, report writing.

title: Projects
text:
Skin Cancer Classification Prediction



Machine Learning

Python

Health



Comparing regularized logistic regression and tree-based models for skin cancer detection.















Student Habits & Academic Success



Statistics

R

Education



Predicting academic performance from study habits using R & ML.















Firestorm – Visualizing Wildfire Patterns



Data Visualization

Geospatial

Team Project



Turning geospatial wildfire data into clear visuals and stories for non-technical audiences.

title: Joshua (Xingwang) Zhang
text:
I’m an undergraduate Statistics & Data Science student at UCLA who loves turning messy data into clear stories and useful tools. Outside of class, I run an Amazon e-commerce business, manage an Airbnb, and build data-driven dashboards and models for real-world problems.
When I’m not debugging R or Python, you can probably find me playing basketball, practicing piano or guitar, or testing a new 3D-printed idea.

title: Joshua (Xingwang) Zhang
text:
Education
University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) · Los Angeles, CA
B.S. in Statistics & Data Science · Expected June 2026
- Interests: data science, analytics.

title: Joshua (Xingwang) Zhang
text:
Experience
Hurams Work LLC · Co-Founder & Data Analyst · 2021 – 02/2025
- Built and scaled an Amazon e-commerce operation (5,000+ orders, six-figure annual revenue).
- Analyzed sales, pricing, and advertising data in R/Excel to optimize product mix and profits.
- Designed dashboards to track unit economics, inventory, refunds, and customer satisfaction
(98%+ positive rating).
- Coordinated suppliers, logistics, and customer messaging to keep operations smooth.
Airbnb Host & Operations Analyst · 06/2025 – 09/2025
- Manage day-to-day operations for a short-term rental property.
- Built spreadsheets to track occupancy, pricing, cleaning costs, and repair/claim history.
- Use data to adjust pricing strategy and improve guest experience and review scores.
Academic & Project Work · UCLA
- Collaborate on statistics and data-science projects with classmates from psychology, sociology, and statistics courses.
- Present data stories using R, Quarto, and BetterPoster-style visualizations.

title: Joshua (Xingwang) Zhang
text:
Selected Projects
Student Habits & Academic Success: A Behavioral Analysis
- Modeled the relationship between study habits, sleep, time management, and grades.
- Used R (tidyverse, ggplot2) for cleaning, EDA, and classification models (logistic / glmnet).
- Communicated findings in a 6-minute talk with visualizations and an R Quarto report.
Skin Cancer Classification with Machine Learning
- Compared regularized logistic regression (lasso/ridge) and tree-based models on image features.
- Tuned hyperparameters via cross-validation; evaluated with accuracy, ROC curves, and confusion matrices.
Firestorm: Connecting Wildfire Data to People
- Built a team website that visualizes fire-pattern and detection data.
- Focused on making complex spatial data understandable for non-technical audiences using clear charts and explanations.

title: Joshua (Xingwang) Zhang
text:
Skills
Programming & Tools
R (tidyverse, ggplot2, caret, glmnet), Python (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn), SQL, Git/GitHub,
Quarto, Markdown, Excel/Google Sheets, Tableau/Power BI (familiar), LaTeX/Overleaf (basic).
Data Skills
Data wrangling, feature engineering, exploratory data analysis, visualization, regression and classification models, cross-validation, reporting, and reproducible workflows.
Other
Project coordination, small-business operations, customer communication (English & Chinese), presentation and technical writing.
